d: Simon is a highly adaptable shirt pattern for people without breasts.

s.cutUndercollarSmaller: Cut the undercollar a little bit smaller

backDarts.d: Whether or not to include back darts

backDarts.auto.d: Add back darts (only) when doing so will improve fit

backDarts.never.d: Never add back darts, handle shaping elsewhere instead

backDarts.always.d: Always include back darts, even when shaping is minimal

backDartShaping.d: The amount of shaping that is done by the back darts

barrelCuffNarrowButton.d: Whether to include a button to tie the cuffs more narrow. This option is only relevant for barrel cuffs.

barrelCuffNarrowButtonNo.t: Do not include a narrow button
barrelCuffNarrowButtonNo.d: Draft a pattern with a single button on the cuffs

barrelCuffNarrowButtonYes.d: Draft a pattern with an extra button on the cuffs to tie them more narrow

boxPleat.d: Whether to include a box pleat at the back or not

boxPleatNo.d: Draft a pattern without a box pleat

boxPleatYes.d: Draft a pattern with a box pleat

boxPleatWidth.d: The total width of the box pleat

boxPleatFold.d: The amount by with the box pleat folds inwards

buttonPlacketStyle.seamless.d: A seamless button placket gives a more modern look

buttonFreeLength.d: How much of the bottom of the front closure to keep button-free.

buttonholePlacketFoldWidth.d: Width of the buttonhole placket fold.

buttonholePlacketStyle.classic.d: A classic buttonhole placket with pleats

buttonholePlacketStyle.seamless.d: A seamless buttonhole placket gives a more modern look

buttons.d: The number of buttons on the front closure.

collarAngle.d: The angle of the collar tips.

collarFlare.d: The flare of the collar tips.

collarGap.d: The gap between the two collar ends.

collarRoll.d: The amount by which the top collar is larger than the undercollar.

collarWidth.d: Width of the collar relative to collar stand.

collarStandBend.d: The bend of the collar stand.

collarStandCurve.d: The curve of the collar stand.

cuffButtonRows.d: Whether to draft a single or double row of cuff buttons. This option is only relevant for barrel cuffs.

cuffDrape.d: The amount by which the sleeve is wider than the cuff where the are joined.

cuffStyle.d: What style of cuffs do you prefer?

cuffStyle.roundedBarrelCuff.d: A classic barrel cuff, but with rounded corners

cuffStyle.angledBarrelCuff.d: A classic barrel cuff, but with angled (chamfered) corners

cuffStyle.roundedFrenchCuff.d: A French cuff (the type you need cufflinks for) with rounded corners

cuffStyle.angledFrenchCuff.d: A French cuff (the type you need cufflinks for) with angled (chamnfered) corners

cuffStyle.straightFrenchCuff.d: A straight French cuff (the type you need cufflinks for)

extraTopButton.d: Whether or not to include an extra top button between the collar button and the first shirt button on the front closure.

extraTopButtonNo.d: Draft a pattern without an extra top button

extraTopButtonYes.d: Draft a pattern with an extra top button

ffsa.d: The amount of seam allowance on flat-felled seams as a proportion of the regular seam allowance

hemCurve.d: The height of the curve on a curved hem.

hemStyle.d: The style of the shirt hem.

hemStyle.baseball.d: Draft a so-called baseball hem that curves upwards towards the sides

hemStyle.slashed.d: Draft a so-called slashed hem that is mostly straight but then sharply turns upwards at the sides

hipsEase.d: Controls the amount of ease at the hips.

roundBack.d: To fit a round(er) back, this adds length to the center back (at the yoke) that tapers of towards the sides.

separateButtonholePlacketNo.t: Do not separate the buttonhole placket
separateButtonholePlacketNo.d: Draft a pattern where the buttonhole placket is attached to the front

separateButtonholePlacketYes.d: Draft a pattern where the buttonhole placket is separated from the front, allowing one to use a different fabric or grain for the buttonhole placket

separateButtonPlacketNo.t: Do not separate the button placket
separateButtonPlacketNo.d: Draft a pattern where the button placket is attached to the front

separateButtonPlacketYes.d: Draft a pattern where the button placket is separated from the front, allowing one to use a different fabric or grain for the button placket

sleevePlacketLength.d: The length of the sleeve placket.

sleevePlacketWidth.d: The width of the sleeve placket.

splitYoke.d: Whether to draft a split or regular yoke. A split yoke is typically used for using a different grainline on both halves for visual effect

splitYokeNo.d: Draft a pattern with a single full-size yoke

splitYokeYes.d: Draft a pattern with a yoke split in half

waistEase.d: The amount of ease at your (natural) waist.

yokeHeight.d: Controls the height of the yoke
